pull.title: [test] Add CCoinsViewCache Access/Modify/Write tests
pull.body: Add more comprehensive unit tests for CCoinsViewCache. Right now it is hard to refactor caching code or fix bugs in the caching logic because you have to try to mentally enumerate all the different states the cache might be in to make sure a change doesn't cause unintended consequences. The new tests explicitly enumerate relevant cache states, documenting and verifying the behavior in each state, so it will be safer and easier to make changes to the caching code in the future.

events.message:
[test] Add CCoinsViewCache Access/Modify/Write tests

Add more comprehensive unit tests for CCoinsViewCache. Right now it is hard to
refactor caching code or fix bugs in the caching logic because you have to try
to mentally enumerate all the different states the cache might be in to make
sure a change doesn't cause unintended consequences. The new tests explicitly
enumerate relevant cache states, documenting and verifying the behavior in each
state, so it will be safer and easier to make changes to the caching code in
the future.

issue.title: Assert FRESH validity in CCoinsViewCache::BatchWrite
issue.body: This change adds a check for the validity of the FRESH flag in `CCoinsViewCache::BatchWrite`. The check added here is analogous to the assert @morcos is adding in #9107. It is checking the same condition, just inside a different method (`BatchWrite` instead of `ModifyNewCoins`).

events.body: utACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9308/commits/03ffa4cfff29d8273859edb030bc0eb823b26e7b, thanks for adding tests for this important system
ACK (left a couple of comments to slightly increase test coverage)

issue.title: CCoinsViewCache code cleanup & deduplication
issue.body:
CCoinsViewCache code cleanup & deduplication

The change moves code responsible for updating the cache out of various
CCoinsViewCache methods and into a Modifier class. This way the cache update
code is just written once in a general way instead of being duplicated and
split up to handle various special cases.

This is a refactoring, with changes to cache behavior only in 2 corner cases
(with corresponding tests in coins_test.cpp) which don't affect the meaning of
data stored in the cache:

* In BatchWrite, overwriting a non-dirty pruned cache entry with a fresh pruned
  cache entry now deletes the cache entry instead of leaving behind a dirty
  pruned entry that will trigger an unnecessary database write later.

* In BatchWrite, overwriting a dirty pruned fresh cache entry with a nonpruned
  entry updates the entry without dropping the fresh flag. There's no reason to
  drop the fresh flag in this case because the flag accurately describes the
  state of the base view and could prevent unnecessary database writes in the
  future if the utxo is spent later.

events.body:
@ryanofsky What about this warning?
```
test/coins_tests.cpp:432:19: warning: unused variable 'DIRTY_FLAGS' [-Wunused-const-variable]
```

Do you plan to use it or can it be removed?

issue.title: Removed unused variable in test, fixing warning.

events.body: I do have some debug code using it, which I might make a PR from later, but its better to remove for now since it's causing this warning. Created to #9435 to remove.

issue.title: Coins - improve test coverage + misc
issue.body:
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9307 - Remove undefined FetchCoins method declaration 
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9308 - [test] Add CCoinsViewCache Access/Modify/Write tests   
** Removed tests for ModifyNewCoin, which we haven't added (and is deprecated/removed in Core)
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9310 - Assert FRESH validity in CCoinsViewCache::BatchWrite   
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10249 - Switch CCoinsMap from boost to std unordered_map

issue.title: [Core] Safer modify new coins
issue.body:
Going on with the coins view cache update work (started with #1774 and #1777).
This backports the following upstream PRs (adapting them with the assumption that duplicate coinbase transactions are not possible):

- bitcoin/bitcoin#9308 - [test] Add CCoinsViewCache Access/Modify/Write tests
- bitcoin/bitcoin#9107 - Safer modify new coins
- bitcoin/bitcoin#9310 - Assert FRESH validity in CCoinsViewCache::BatchWrite
- bitcoin/bitcoin#9435 - Removed unused variable in test, fixing warning.

Note: Will rebase #1773 on top of this one (to change `ApplyTxInUndo` return value in the unit test too).

issue.title: Backport of bitcoin/bitcoin#10195
issue.body:
Backport of bitcoin/bitcoin#10195 (bitcoin/bitcoin@1088b02f0ccd7358d2b7076bb9e122d59d502d02)

Work tree so far (read bottom-up)

- merge #4980 
- merge #4979 
- cherry-pick bitcoin/bitcoin@e484652fc
  - requires bitcoin/bitcoin#9260 or patch to main.cpp
    - 0001-Introduce-CHashVerifier-to-hash-read-data.patch
- cherry-pick bitcoin/bitcoin@f54580e7e
  - requires bitcoin/bitcoin#9260 or patch to main.cpp
    - 0001-error-in-disconnect-for-disk-corruption-not-inconsis.patch
      - cherry-pick bitcoin/bitcoin@b50cd7a67e from bitcoin/bitcoin#9107
        - cherry-pick bitcoin/bitcoin@07df40babb for coins_tests.cpp from bitcoin/bitcoin#9308
           - removed coinbase-specific sections
        - bitcoin/bitcoin@8504867b14: IGNORED, part of bitcoin/bitcoin#7056 that is not relevant to us
        - requires bitcoin/bitcoin@14470f9aa6 from bitcoin/bitcoin#6932: MERGED already in 2018
        - bitcoin/bitcoin#6931: IGNORED
          - No need for bitcoin/bitcoin@06d81ad516 but noted that we can 
            remove the "tried to overwrite transaction" check.
          - bitcoin/bitcoin@33c90cf1972 IGNORED
        - cherry-pick bitcoin/bitcoin@072e2f86444 from bitcoin/bitcoin#5967 
          - required zcash-specific changes
- cherry-pick bitcoin/bitcoin@e66dbde6d14
  - requires bitcoin/bitcoin#9346 
    - cherry-pick bitcoin/bitcoin@ed58969
